titles.title: Relating to the House procedures contained in section 803 of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.
Relating to the House procedures contained in section 803 of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-769, by Mr. Hastings (FL).
The resolution provides that section 803 of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 shall not apply during the remainder of the 110th Congress.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 254.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1368.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1368, the Chair put the question on adoption and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Drier (WA) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on H.Res. 1368 until later in the legislative day.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 184 (Roll no. 532).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Provides that House of Representatives procedures under the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 for the consideration of proposed legislation by the President to respond to a Medicare funding warning shall not apply during the remainder of the 110th Congress.
